result.name: gsni-tellus-regional-airborne-geophysical-survey-electromagnetic-grids
result.notes:
Data were processed using Geosoft Oasis Montaj and supplied in three formats.

* Geosoft Grid
* ESRI Geodatabase
* ASCII Grid

Note that the presence of ‘Minc from V3 gdb, cellsize 35m’ in the grid filename indicates that the grid was generated using the Minimum Curvature interpolation method, from data contained within the Electromagnetics V3 database, using a cell size of 35m.

The following file are provided:

##TELLUS_Electromagnetic (Minc from V3 gdb, cellsize 35m) 3KHz_Acon_FLT
3 kHz Apparent Conductivity generated using the Minimum Curvature interpolation method, from data contained within the 3KHz_Acon_FLT channel of the Electromagnetics V3 database, using a cell size of 35m.

##TELLUS_Electromagnetic (Minc from V3 gdb, cellsize 35m) 3KHz_Acon_FLT_GRD_s
A sunshade of the 3 kHz Apparent Conductivity generated using the Minimum Curvature interpolation method, from data contained within the 3KHz_Acon_FLT channel of the Electromagnetics V3 database, using a cell size of 35m Shading parameters (inclination = 45 degrees, declination = 0 degrees).

##TELLUS_Electromagnetic (Minc from V3 gdb, cellsize 35m) 14KHz_Acon_FLT
14 kHz Apparent Conductivity generated using the Minimum Curvature interpolation method, from data contained within the 14KHz_Acon_FLT channel of the Electromagnetics V3 database, using a cell size of 35m.

##TELLUS_Electromagnetic (Minc from V3 gdb, cellsize 35m) 14KHz_Acon_FLT_GRD_s
A sunshade of the 14 kHz Apparent Conductivity generated using the Minimum Curvature interpolation method, from data contained within the 14KHz_Acon_FLT channel of the Electromagnetics V3 database, using a cell size of 35m Shading parameters (inclination = 45 degrees, declination = 0 degrees).

organization.name: open-data-ni
organization.title: OpenDataNI
organization.description:
[OpenDataNI] (https://www.opendatani.gov.uk) is the brand name for the Open Data portal which facilitates easy access to Northern Ireland public sector data for both reuse and redistribution. 

OpenDataNI has been developed as part of the Digital NI initiative. Digital NI aims to help establish a culture within Northern Ireland that develops and enhances Digital capability not just through interactions with Government, but also with local companies and throughout communities. Within government the Digital Transformation Service is facilitating this cultural shift through a number of methods, transforming Government services, making data open and available and encouraging and coaching those who lack digital skills.

It is recognised that opening up our data is the right thing to do in terms of transparency, accountability and efficiency of the Public Sector in Northern Ireland. It has the potential to encourage new commercial opportunities and drive economic growth and innovation across public and private sectors.

result.title: GSNI Tellus Regional Airborne Geophysical Survey - Electromagnetic Grids

resources.description: This zip file contains a series of grids in Geosoft Grid format that were produced as part of the Tellus Airborne Geophysical Survey of Northern Ireland.
resources.name: Tellus Electromagnetics Grids - Geosoft Grid

resources.description: This zip file contains an ESRI Geodatabase with a series of grids that were produced as part of the Tellus Airborne Geophysical Survey of Northern Ireland.
resources.name: Tellus Electromagnetics Grids - ESRI Grid

resources.description: This zip file contains a series of grids in ASCII format that were produced as part of the Tellus Airborne Geophysical Survey of Northern Ireland.
resources.name: Tellus Electromagnetics Grids - ASCII Grid
